activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell C. Martin

Activity: Preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:09 AM Defendant Russell C. Martin in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Jacob Mielke of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Arraignment to be scheduled with branch 6 to follow with case 22CF555.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:36 PM Defendant Russell C. Martin in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Faun Michelle Moses and intern Olivia Long by video. Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.
